sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]Â ''novels Osha, is a capable spearwife and raider who becomes a servant of the Starks at Winterfell. She is tall and lean with shaggy brown hair, and significantly older than how she is portrayed in the TV series.

In the novels, Osha never had sex with Theon. After he conquered Winterfell, she requested to serve him as fighter, and he agreed on condition that she bent her knee and swore an oath to him. Osha did as he demanded, but it was only pretense.

There is no mentioning in the novels of any husband or other relatives of Osha.

She is described as strong, being able to lift Bran with ease. She is also somewhat informal, dubbing Theon "that squiddy prince" behind his back.

"Osha" is pronounced "oh-shuh", not "ah-shuh", "osh-uh", "ahsh-uh", etc.
sections.Quotes:
{{Quote|A red comet means one thing, boy. Dragons.|'''Osha''' to Bran Stark|The North Remembers}}
{{Quote|I tried telling your brother, he's marching the wrong way. All these swords, they should be going north, boy, not south. The cold winds are rising.|Osha to [[Bran Stark]]|The Pointy End}}
